name: Main Street Station Hotel & Casino

reviews.text: We've stayed at Main Street Station several times over the years when meeting up with family from Hawaii. It really does feel like I'd imagine a casino in Hawaii (at least the people there :). It isn't a fancy place, but it's well kept and has a bit of a homey feel to it.
reviews.title: Good value...like a casino in Hawaii

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm not a huge fan of the Fremont street area, but gambling in the California and Main Street are pretty relaxing to me.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: The strip gets pricey on the weekends and my wife had never seen the Fremont street experience so I booked a Fri/Sat here. I had been to the brew pub on a previous trip and liked the selection of ales. We had fun and I would definitely stay here again. We are budget travelers and have no qualms about catching the bus (duece) to go to strip attractions.
reviews.title: A great Location

likes.liked: — Very comfortable, terrific bed, great food in all three restaurants

reviews.text: What a great place to stay! Very comfortable and everyone friendly! Ours needs were met even with a coffee pot in the room. It's very close to the Fremont Experience. We'll stay again when we go to Las Vegas.
reviews.title: Not Bad for Downtown
Main Street Station-a great place in Vegas
reviews.text: I have been to Vegas many times but have never stayed downtown so I thought I'd try the Main Street Station for 1 night. The hotel itself is fine - lobby is designed in a faux old west motif. Check in and out was quick and the brew pub had prompt service and ok food. The room (17th floor) was nice and a bit larger than expected, but I still heard train noise at night. The neighborhood is sketchy and even though I am a NYer by birth, was a little uncomfortable walking the 2 blocks back from the delightfully tacky Fremont Street Experience at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at the Mainstreet Station.Rooms are clean,A/C worked fine.They have there own brewary,Had hot wings at 4:30 AM.What is better than that.We almost always stay downtown and have stayed in almost all casino/hotels there.This one ranks very high(maybe the GN a bit nicer),for the price this is the place you want to stay.
reviews.title: Good place,Good price

reviews.text: Booked MSS through Hotels.com as we needed to arrive Saturday and leave Monday ,
reviews.title: Great Place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 5 of us stayed and check in was efficient and we got adjoining rooms with a rollaway bed. The rooms were big enough and clean .
reviews.title: Great place to stay! Good casino too

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The casino was great, really friendly clientele, the buffet great and really cheap with vouchers and the 77 brewery restaurant superb.
reviews.title: LOVE this place - Best in Vegas!

reviews.text: Its in a good location not too far from Fremont.
reviews.title: Kiddie Free Hotel in Downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My DH and I stayed here in July for 1 night. We have never stayed downtown and since we were arriving on a Saturday, this seemed like a good (and economical) choice to give DT a try. We arrived at 9:30 am and were promptly given a room. Asked for a quiet room and that is exactly what we got! We could see the FSE lights from our room, but could not hear any noise (including from the trains).
reviews.title: Excellent Value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM was very clean and everything worked well. Only negative is the size and age of the bathroom. Shower head was so short DH had to tip it all the way up to be able to even get under it. Tile and grout were old and stained up, but kept clean in spite of the age.
reviews.title: Couldn't beat the price, but still like the strip better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD - only had the Champagne Brunch. It was good, as MSS buffet usually is. Had 2/1 coupon so it was also very inexpensive. Brought the champagne in little plastic cups. Kind of seemed odd as everything else seemed pretty upscale. Definitely not a big deal though.
reviews.title: Another great stay at the MSS

reviews.text: Love the CASINO - always have!
reviews.title: Nice option downtown!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall very good stay. Good rooms, good customer service, good food and great casino! We definitely plan to stay here again, but for more then 1 day next time!
reviews.title: We loved staying downtown at the Main Street Station
I love this hotel
reviews.text: We go to Vegas at least three times each year and this is the only hotel that I have stayed at more than once. I really like this little hotel. It is very neat and clean throughout especially in public restrooms, restaurant and rooms. The beds are super comfortable with pillow top mattresses and down comforters. The casino was not very smoky this trip - maybe they've corrected the ventilation problem or maybe people don't smoke as much as they used to. Parking is easy, valet and bell are super kind, check in easy, room was always cleaned in a.m. Quiet in rooms. What more can you ask for?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel room is really great. Elegance design and clean. I miss the bed very much, it’s really comfortable.
reviews.title: My best stay ever

reviews.text: Their service is very good also. My hubby and I have been driving from LA and arrived hotel earlier. We were so tired after sleepless night, and the staff are so thoughtful. They let us check in early and we were so surprise with the room condition with the price we paid.
reviews.title: Very clean and an excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet at hotel is cheap and nice as well.
reviews.title: Stayed many times at Main Street Station, but first review!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean & recently renovated. Everyone that I dealt with at the hotel was pleasant. If you are looking for a super fancy hotel with spas & other mega hotel amenities go elsewhere. If you are looking for a safe & clean room Downtown where the gaming & dining are much cheaper, this is an excellent choice. It's the most laid back place I've stayed at in LV. The breakfast buffet was excellent and had lots of healthy selections.
reviews.title: Great Value with atmosphere!

aka: Main Street Station Hotel Las Vegas
description: Victorian architecture & ambience - 1 block north of Fremont St.
